results.title: Aurore
results.brief_description:
Episode 2 of Series “Lagardere”.
Lagardere is in hiding in Spain with Aurore. He is still seeking to kill all those involved in that fateful night at Caylus 15 years ago. Each of his murders his signed with the famous ‘Nevers lunge’, a bloodied star on the forehead of the victim. Philippe has married Blanche in the hope of seizing her estate. He also keeps an army of informers whose mission it is to locate Lagardere and kidnap Aurore.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin.

results.title: Australia's Great Barrier Reef
results.creator_credit: Russell Kelley, Janine Hedley, David Reed, David Hannan, Television New Zealand Natural History Unit and David Hannan Productions
results.brief_description: Australia’s Great Barrier Reef is a visually vibrant documentary about the strange summer mating rituals that have resulted in the formation of one of the most stunning natural wonders of the world. A spectacular and sometimes surreal celebration of coral and reef society in general, focusing on the tactics used to perpetuate the species. Originally screened as “Sex of the Reef”. Winner of Golden Tripod Award for Wildlife and Nature at 25th Australian International Cinematographers Society Awards, and Gold Award Nature and Wildlife at the US International Film and Video Festival 1993.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Russell Kelley, Janine Hedley, David Reed, David Hannan, Television New Zealand Natural History Unit and David Hannan Productions

results.title: Aussie fit: getting started
results.creator_credit: Debbie Hides, John Novak, Bryan Lowe and BM International
results.brief_description: This gentle routine for beginners is designed for all shapes, sizes and ages to burn off that excess weight and to gently tone flagging muscles. Follow the exercises at your own pace and gradually work up to a level that suits your individual needs. Also included is a bonus stretch section that shows how to achieve flexibility and suppleness throughout the body. WARNING: Please take note and heed the cautionary warning at the beginning of this video.

results.title: Le Petit Parisien = the Little Parisian
results.brief_description:
Episode 1 of Series “Lagardere”.
Philippe de Gonzague has vowed to become the master of the richest estate in France. To achieve this, he has to destroy the lives of all those standing in his way. His first victim will be his friend Philippe de Nevers, his wife Blanche de Caylus and their young daughter, Aurore, who stands to inherit the estate. Gonzague sends two fencing masters, Staupitz and Cocardasse to eliminate Nevers, meanwhile, Henri (aka the little Parisian) who works as an acrobat in a travelling circus is told by his nanny the secret of his origins. As Henri comes out to stake his claim on his estate, he finds himself embroiled in Gonzague’s web of intrigue, murder and kidnapping. This popular story hs been adapted to the screen many times. See also in our collection: ‘The hunchback’ (X000159).

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin.

results.title: Le Bal du Regent = the Regent's Ball
results.brief_description:
Episode 3 of Series “Lagardere”.
Aurore has moved in with Suzanne, Lagardere’s old nanny, to try and avoid the spies sent by Philippe de Gonzague. Henri is trying to track down Blanche, Aurore’s mother. Little does he know that she is now married to Philippe de Gonzague. Gonzague has devised a scheme to introduce to Blanche a young orphan named Flor who is to pass for Aurore.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin, Dominique Paturel.

results.title: Les Noces du Bossu = the Wedding of the Hunchback
results.brief_description:
Episode 4 of Series “Lagardere”.
Philippe de Gonzague is to introduce Flor alias Aurore to the Regent during a Royal Gala. This is also the setting chosen by Lagardere to reinstate Aurore in her rights.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin, Dominique Paturel, Edmond Ardisson, Henri Attal, Raoul Billerey, Raymond Gerome, Michel Grellier, Dominique Zardi, Sacha Pitoeff.

results.title: Aussie Ashes win
results.brief_description: After crushing the Brits with a 4-0 sweep in the 2021 Ashes series, the Aussie team celebrated with the customary champagne popping. But not everyone could join in. Skipper Pat Cummins told the players to put down the bottles so Usman Khawaja, who is Muslim and doesn’t drink alcohol, could rejoin. Khawaja killed it in the fourth test, where he made a century in both innings he played. He tweeted the footage, heralding the moment as a step ‘in the right direction’ towards better inclusivity, acknowledging that there’s more work to be done to address racism in Australian sport.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

After crushing the Brits with a 4-0 sweep in the 2021 Ashes series, the Aussie team celebrated with the customary champagne popping. But not everyone could join in. Usman Khawaja was integral throughout the series, particularly in the fourth test when he made a century in both innings, but as a Muslim doesn’t drink alcohol. Skipper Pat Cummins told the players to put down the bottles so that he could rejoin the festivities. Khawaja retweeted the footage, heralding the moment as a step ‘in the right direction’ towards better inclusivity, subtly acknowledging that there’s more work to be done to address racism in Australian sport.

Read Osman Faruqi’s analysis of the moment on they Sydney Morning Herald.
description_for_label: After crushing the Brits with a 4-0 sweep in the 2021 Ashes series, the Aussie team celebrated with the customary champagne popping. But not everyone could join in. Usman Khawaja was integral throughout the series, particularly in the fourth test when he made a century in both innings, but as a Muslim doesn’t drink alcohol. Skipper Pat Cummins told the players to put down the bottles so that he could rejoin the festivities. Khawaja retweeted the footage, heralding the moment as a step ‘in the right direction’ towards better inclusivity, subtly acknowledging that there’s more work to be done to address racism in Australian sport.

results.title: Le Defile de Poncarbo = the Gorges of Poncarbo
results.brief_description:
Episode 5 of Series “Lagardere”.
Following his humiliation at the Regent’s ball, Philippe de Gonzague flees the court, taking Flor and Aurore as hostages. On his way to Spain, Gonzague and his aides stop at an inn. There they plot to assassinate their pursuant with the help of local ruffians.

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin
